title: Kinnary H. Shah
text:
Thanks for taking a look at my website!
My name is Kinnary (kin-uh-ree) Shah and I am working on my PhD at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health in the Department of Biostatistics. I received my Bachelor’s degree in Biomathematics & Public Health from Rutgers University - New Brunswick, where I completed research projects in computational genetics and public policy. Outside of academics, I enjoy experimenting in the kitchen and hand building slab pottery.

title: Research
text:
In collaboration with Dr. Stephanie Hicks and researchers at the Lieber Institute for Brain Development, I am currently working on spatial transcriptomics methods development and data analysis projects.
I will be attending my first in-person conference in August 2023! I am excited to present my methods work as a short talk at BioConductor.

title: Teaching
text:
I have served as a teaching assistant for the following courses:

Multilevel Models (June 2023)
Statistical Methods in Public Health I-IV (2022-2023 school year)
